newsitem.title: UK: Hardy Oil in new 200 mln stg credit facility. [CORRECTED 08:12 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Hardy Oil in new 200 mln stg credit facility. [CORRECTED 08:12 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects currency in headline and text to 200 million stg from $200 million)
Hardy Oil & Gas Plc has arranged a new 200 million stg bank credit facility to finance future investment and acquisition opportunities.

The company announced the facility on Tuesday in a statement on its results showing a net profit of 5.7 million pounds in the nine months to December 31, 1996, compared to a loss of 6.6 million pounds in the year to March, 1996.
The company is actively pursuing opportunities for growth in its targeted core areas of the UK continental shelf, Australia and Pakistan, as well as India.
Hardy plans a total of 17 exploration and appraisal wells this year.
Since the end of 1996 it has agreed to acquire for 2.9 million pounds cash a 15.5 percent share in Hindustan Oil Exploration Co Ltd, an independent Indian exploration and production company.

'Overall the group's total capital expenditure in 1997 is planned to be 80 million pounds, of which approximately 20 million pounds will be committed to exploration and appraisal,' Hardy said in a statement.
